intro: Fimbristylis sororia, commonly known as the slender spike-rush, is a grass-like plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas, particularly found in wetlands and marshy areas. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered spikes of pale brown flowers. It typically grows in shallow water or moist soil, and its rhizomes help it spread vegetatively. Fimbristylis sororia plays a role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for small aquatic organisms.
